elements.title: a synagogue-turned-church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a synagogue-turned-church (pictured) was marketed for sale as a potential nightclub?

elements.title: Len Garrett (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that NFL player Len Garrett was nicknamed "Graveyard"?

elements.title: Three Dances (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Three Dances has been described as both characteristic and uncharacteristic of composer Henryk Górecki's work?

elements.title: a birdwatching documentary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the idea for a birdwatching documentary was conceived while one of its creators was high on marijuana?

elements.title: 2000 International Chopin Piano Competition (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Yundi won the 2000 International Chopin Piano Competition, after 15 years without a first prize awarded?

elements.title: Beaulieu Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Beaulieu Park is the first new station on the Great Eastern Main Line in more than 100 years?

elements.title: a fashion show based on a dance marathon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that models danced until they seemed to collapse in a fashion show based on a dance marathon?

elements.title: Edwin Boxshall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Edwin Boxshall, described as Britain's longest-serving spy, was still advising the Foreign Office right up to the time of his death?

elements.title: Bienor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bienor is a very long space centaur?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
